channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: House Republicans prepare to hold Attorney General Garland in contempt
item.description: The House is expected to vote Wednesday on a resolution to hold Attorney General Merrick Garland in contempt.
item.content:encoded:
The House is expected to vote Wednesday on a resolution to hold Attorney General Merrick Garland in contempt.

(Image credit: Mandel Ngan)
item.dc:creator: Carrie Johnson

item.title: Analysis of what a hidden microphone may have revealed about the Supreme Court
item.description: NPR's Steve Inskeep asks legal analyst Sarah Isgur for her reaction to the secret recordings of Supreme Court Chief Justice John Roberts and Justice Samuel Alito and his wife.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Steve Inskeep asks legal analyst Sarah Isgur for her reaction to the secret recordings of Supreme Court Chief Justice John Roberts and Justice Samuel Alito and his wife.
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: A filmmaker secretly records Supreme Court Chief Justice Roberts and Justice Alito
item.description: NPR's Steve Inskeep asks filmmaker Lauren Windsor about her secret recordings of John Roberts and Samuel Alito.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Steve Inskeep asks filmmaker Lauren Windsor about her secret recordings of John Roberts and Samuel Alito.
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: Why G7 leaders are turning to a special guest — Pope Francis — for advice on AI
item.description: G7 leaders are meeting in Italy, where Pope Francis will join them to talk about the ethics of artificial intelligence.
item.content:encoded:
G7 leaders are meeting in Italy, where Pope Francis will join them to talk about the ethics of artificial intelligence.

(Image credit: Alessandra Tarantino/POOL)
item.dc:creator: Deepa Shivaram

item.title: African ancestry genes may be linked to Black Americans' risk for some brain disorders
item.description: A new genomic analysis hints at why African Americans face a higher risk of Alzheimer’s and stroke, but a lower risk of Parkinson’s.
item.content:encoded:
A new genomic analysis hints at why African Americans face a higher risk of Alzheimer’s and stroke, but a lower risk of Parkinson’s.

(Image credit: TEK IMAGE/SCIENCE PHOTO LIBRARY)
item.dc:creator: Jon Hamilton

item.title: Biden administration announces a plan for removing medical debt from credit reports
item.description: The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau released proposed federal regulations that would prevent unpaid medical bills from being counted on consumers’ credit reports.
item.content:encoded:
The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau released proposed federal regulations that would prevent unpaid medical bills from being counted on consumers’ credit reports.

(Image credit: Smith Collection/Gado/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Noam Levey

item.title: This prison newspaper has been publishing for more than a century
item.description: A newspaper in a Minnesota prison began publishing more than a century ago. The paper covers prison life and gives its writers purpose. It’s one of around two dozen similar publications nationwide.
item.content:encoded:
A newspaper in a Minnesota prison began publishing more than a century ago. The paper covers prison life and gives its writers purpose. It’s one of around two dozen similar publications nationwide.

(Image credit: Kerem Yücel)
item.dc:creator: Meg Anderson

item.title: Hawaii's birds are going extinct. Their last hope could be millions of mosquitoes
item.description: Hawaii's unique birds, known as honeycreepers, are being wiped out by mosquitoes carrying avian malaria. The birds' last hope could be more mosquitoes, designed to crash their own population.
item.content:encoded:
Hawaii's unique birds, known as honeycreepers, are being wiped out by mosquitoes carrying avian malaria. The birds' last hope could be more mosquitoes, designed to crash their own population.

(Image credit: Ryan Kellman)
item.dc:creator: Lauren Sommer

item.title: A check on inflation and whether interest rates could be lowered
item.description: The Labor Department reports Wednesday on what happened with inflation last month. Later, the Federal Reserve will provide an updated forecast of where interest rates are going.
item.content:encoded: The Labor Department reports Wednesday on what happened with inflation last month. Later, the Federal Reserve will provide an updated forecast of where interest rates are going.
item.dc:creator: Scott Horsley

item.title: President Biden shows support for his son Hunter after being convicted in gun case
item.description: President Biden made a quick trip to Delaware after his son Hunter was convicted of felony gun charges. It's not clear whether Hunter Biden will appeal the conviction, or when sentencing will occur.
item.content:encoded: President Biden made a quick trip to Delaware after his son Hunter was convicted of felony gun charges. It's not clear whether Hunter Biden will appeal the conviction, or when sentencing will occur.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Lucas
